thread.title: Miss. State Fair sues to compel Jackson police protection
thread.title_full: Miss. State Fair sues to compel Jackson police protection - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Miss. State Fair sues to compel Jackson police protection
text:
JACKSON, Miss. (AP) - The Mississippi State Fair Commission is suing the city of Jackson to try to force the police department to provide security and traffic control outside the fairgrounds.
The 12-day state fair starts Wednesday.
The Clarion-Ledger reports ( http://on.thec-l.com/1JKHPBt ) the commission filed a complaint Friday in Hinds County Chancery Court, and a hearing is set for Tuesday.
Jackson Police announced this year it wouldn't provide help during the State Fair because of city budget cuts. Police Chief Lee Vance says Jackson typically pays about $320,000 in personnel and overtime costs for the annual event.
In previous years, Jackson has provided up to 70 police officers to help with State Fair security.
The Hinds County Sheriff's Department still plans to provide protection this year on the fairgrounds, near downtown Jackson.
Information from: The Clarion-Ledger, http://www.clarionledger.com
